content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is not explicitly given. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the graph of the function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is the result of a sequence of transformations to the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>. The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is the result of dilating the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> vertically by a factor of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>, then horizontally by a factor of <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>, then translating the result up by <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math> units, and then left by <math alttext="11"><mn>11</mn></math> units. Which of the following defines <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> in terms of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 third f open parentheses 2 open parentheses x minus 7 close parentheses close parentheses minus 11"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>11</mn></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 half f open parentheses 3 open parentheses x minus 11 close parentheses close parentheses minus 7"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 f open parentheses fraction numerator x plus 11 over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses plus 7"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 f open parentheses fraction numerator x plus 7 over denominator 2 end fraction close parentheses plus 11"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>11</mn></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 f open parentheses fraction numerator x plus 11 over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses plus 7"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
